New Records: Jose Iglesias drove in Tyrone Taylor with a base hit in the 9th inning, leading the Mets to a 3-2 win over the Diamondbacks
Key Match Events: Jesse Winker hit a one-out double in the ninth off Justin Martinez, setting up the winning run for the Mets
Edwin Díaz worked the ninth for his 15th save
Francisco Lindor tied the game at 2 with a solo shot in the sixth
Randal Grichuk put the D-backs up 2-1 in the third on a two-run homer
Pete Alonso homered in the second for the Mets
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said 'I know we're good, we're up to the competition'
Post-Match Reflections: Díaz said 'This team needs me, so I've got to be ready every single day. I've got to do my job always. Today was a good one, but I just have to keep it going now'
Nelson said 'It was pretty close to being a good one, those homers were frustrating and it ended up turning the outcome of the game. I've just got to make better pitches in those spots'
D-backs manager Torey Lovullo said 'We had some opportunities offensively to score some runs and couldn't get the big hit, it happens in this game. We've just got to turn the page'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets improved to 6-4 over their last 10 games
The Mets took two of three in the series, cooling off the surging Diamondbacks
Arizona lost a series for just the second time in the past 17 chances
The Mets start a three-game road series against the Chicago White Sox on Friday
